Package server.dataAccess

Class DataAccess

java.lang.Object
server.dataAccess.DataAccess
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataAccessInterface
public class DataAccess extends Object implements DataAccessInterface
In-memory representation of @DataAccessInterface. Creates, reads, updates, and deletes data stored in memory.

      A map containing all the AuthTokens. Key: Username (String). Value: AuthToken object.

      public Map<Integer,GameData> getGames()

    • clear

      public void clear() throws DataAccessException
      Clears all stored data in the database by calling clear() on all the maps. Will not be available outside of testing.
      Specified by:
      clear in interface DataAccessInterface
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - Throws an error if it's not able to clear the database for some reason.

    • createUser

      public UserData createUser(UserData user) throws DataAccessException
      Creates a new user and stores it in the users map. If the user or username already exist, don't add them again.
      Specified by:
      createUser in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      user - The new user's data.
      Returns:
      The new UserData object.
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - Throw an error if something goes wrong (i.e. the user already exists in the database)

    • findUser

      public UserData findUser(String username)
      Gets a user from the users map and returns it.
      Specified by:
      findUser in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      username - The username we're looking for.
      Returns:
      The UserData object if found in the database, returns null if not found.

    • updateUser

      public UserData updateUser(UserData user) throws DataAccessException
      Updates a user's information in the users map.
      Specified by:
      updateUser in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      user - The user's updated information (As a UserData object).
      Returns:
      The updated UserData object.
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - Throws an error if not able to perform operation.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(UserData user) throws DataAccessException
      Deletes a user from the users map.
      Specified by:
      deleteUser in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      user - The user's information (As a UserData object).
      Throws:
      DataAccessException - Throws an error if it's not possible to delete

    • createGame

      public GameData createGame(String gameName)
      Stores a new game in the database. If the name already exists, don't add the game.
      Specified by:
      createGame in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      gameName - The name of the new game.
      Returns:
      The GameData object that was stored in the database.

    • findGameById

      public GameData findGameById(int gameID)
      Gets a game from the games map and returns it.
      Specified by:
      findGameById in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:
      gameID - The ID of the game we're looking for.
      Returns:
      The requested game if found in the database; null if not found.

    • listGames

      public Collection<GameData> listGames()
      Returns all games in the database (the games map).
      Specified by:
      listGames in interface DataAccessInterface
      Returns:
      The games map which stores all active games, the key is the gameID and value is the GameData.

    • updateGame

      public GameData updateGame(GameData game) throws DataAccessException
      Updates a game in the games map.
      Specified by:
      updateGame in interface DataAccessInterface
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The updated GameData object.
      Throws:

      public AuthToken createAuthToken(String username)

      Returns:
